body: That seems like quite the complex feature to implement for very little gain, so I'm not entirely sure if it's in the scope of this project. If there would be a simple way to do this it would be neat though, probably still a low priority compared to other issues though.
I personally use it a lot in the standard Mac Terminal, along with alt + arrows not working it makes alacritty quite a bit less usable for me.

I think this would actually be pretty easy to implement assuming this winit event is actually implemented for both X11 and macOS. [`winit::WindowEvent::DroppedFile(PathBuf)`](https://docs.rs/winit/0.13.1/winit/enum.WindowEvent.html#variant.DroppedFile) sounds like just what we would need.
Oh yeah that sounds quite convenient.

`DroppedFile` is implemented on Windows, macOS, and X11. In fact, implementing drag and drop on X11 was my very first contribution to winit. I can tell you that the path is pre-canonicalized on X11, though I haven't investigated the exact path format on other platforms; I just know that it works and I've never had trouble loading a file from that path.

(In case you were wondering, `HoveredFile` and `HoveredFileCancelled` are only implemented on macOS and X11, though it doesn't seem like you have to worry about that.)
Thanks for filling in the details @francesca64!

@francesca64 I continue to be amazed by how much time you dedicate to winit. I don't know how you make the time to also follow and comment on winit issues in Alacritty. Thanks again for all your hard work!
@monouser7dig what do you use alt-arrows for? mind making another issue for that if its not configurable yet?

they jump by word left/ right, I believe there is an issue related to winit about it somewhere, there was something about non US keyboards but I actually can't use arrow properly on my US keyboard either. 
something like [this](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/700)
no, that is switching screens (iirc that is both the default and I have not touched it)

issue.title: Paste path into terminal when drag & dropping file
issue.body:
It's now possible to insert the path of a file or directory by dropping
it from the file manager into alacritty.

This fixes #1301.

body:
Implementation was super simple, hopefully this works on all platforms, testing is welcome!

PR: #1304

Interestingly enough, and perhaps related to #675 , I don't immediately see the contents pasted, i have to click on the alacritty window and thats when I guess it gets the event. I wonder if winit is bufferring that event until focus? Could also be related to https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/commit/5be0e3ad8fcde5d8dec98c0e71a2b495294d03be ...

5be0e3a shouldn't have anything to do with this at all. But there's an easy way to figure out if it's buffering the event until focus, or if the window is just not redrawn. If you put a `println!("aaontehu")` in the event handling section (https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/commit/57281363503ddd1ebb373ed5de2b84c79d5aa3aa#diff-3d7686001860aa382f8b9c18554cc138R343), you should see when the event is actually first received. So if it shows the event is received but doesn't show up in the terminal, I might need to set the `dirty` flag. @jedahan
Cool I will test this out tonight thanks for the quick response.

issue.title: Drag & dropping a file into the terminal does not work
issue.body:
### System

OS: ArchLinux
Version: alacritty 0.9.0 (fed349aa)
Linux/BSD: [swaywm](https://swaywm.org/)

### Description

Related to #1301 and #1304.

When dragging a file into the terminal, I'd like its path to be inserted. #1304 indicates that this has been implemented, but I don't know how to make this work (or maybe it's not implemented on Linux?).

Running `alacritty -vv` there's absolutely no log when I drag and drop a file into the terminal.

I'm happy to provide additional information that can help debug why it's not working.
